statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Fairfield 87, Marist 85
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Jonathan Han drove the lane and scored the game-winning basket with 11.7 left in double overtime to lift Fairfield over Marist 87-85 Monday. Han, who played all 50 minutes, finished with 21 points and senior Marty O'Sullivan added a career-high 23 and 10 rebounds for the Stags (12-14, 10-6 MAAC), who won their fifth straight contest. Spongy Benjamin led Marist (15-12, 9-7) with 16 points and 13 rebounds. Jay Gavin added 15 points and David Devezin had 14. Han's basket put Fairfield up 86-85. Sophomore Anthony Johnson made 1-of-2 foul shots with less than 1 second left to give the Stags the 2-pont lead, and the Red Foxes were unable to convert a final shot by Ryan Schneider at the buzzer. The Stags used an 11-3 run over the final five minutes of regulation to force overtime. Han drove the right side of the lane and put one off the glass to tie the game 72-72 with 2.6 seconds left. Johnson, who had 11 points and 10 rebounds for Fairfield, made two foul shots with 19.7 seconds left in the first OT to tie things at 80 and force a second session. O'Sullivan and Han each scored 12 points in the first half to help the Stags build a 41-35 lead. Marist came back in the second half, outscoring Fairfield 25-9 over an 11-minute stretch to take a 60-54 lead with 8:20 left in regulation.
